thread.title: Pan-Pacific expo also showcased city’s dark side
thread.title_full: Pan-Pacific expo also showcased city’s dark side - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Carl Nolte
title: Pan-Pacific expo also showcased city’s dark side
text:
Photo: Franchon Smith, The Chronicle Executive Director Sue Lee talks about the opium paraphernalia history and perceptions during a tour of the “Underground Chinatown” exhibit at the Chinese Historical Society of America Museum in San Francisco. Executive Director Sue Lee talks about the opium paraphernalia...
It is better to celebrate the past than to live in it. For almost a year now, San Francisco has been commemorating the 100th anniversary of the hugely successful and fondly remembered Panama-Pacific International Exposition. Executive Director Sue Lee talks about the opium paraphernalia history and perceptions during a tour of the “Underground Chinatown” exhibit at the Chinese Historical Society of America Museum in San Francisco. Executive Director Sue Lee talks about the opium paraphernalia...
It is better to celebrate the past than to live in it. For almost a year now, San Francisco has been commemorating the 100th anniversary of the hugely successful and fondly remembered Panama-Pacific International Exposition.
